skill.name: internal-comms
skill.description: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my company likes to use. Claude should use this skill whenever asked to write some sort of internal communications (status reports, leadership updates, 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQs, incident reports, project updates, etc.).
skill.summary: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my ...
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: OFFICIAL skill from Anthropic containing only documentation and instruction templates for internal communications. No executable code, network requests, or security concerns detected.

content.value_statement: Helps you write professional internal company communications like team updates, newsletters, and FAQs using proven corporate formats.
actual_capabilities: Generate 3P (Progress, Plans, Problems) team updates in standard format
Create company-wide newsletters with proper structure and tone
Draft FAQ responses for common employee questions
Write general internal communications with appropriate formatting
Integrate information from multiple sources (Slack, email, docs, calendar)
Apply consistent tone and style matching corporate standards
Structure updates with metrics and data-driven content
limitations: Does not have direct access to company tools (Slack, email, Drive) unless provided via MCP
Requires user input if integration tools are unavailable
Cannot verify accuracy of company-specific information without user confirmation
Focuses on format and structure rather than strategic communication decisions

use_cases.title: Weekly Team Updates (3Ps)
use_cases.description: Write concise Progress/Plans/Problems updates for team leads to share with executives and cross-functional partners
use_cases.target_user: Engineering managers, team leads, project managers

use_cases.title: Company-Wide Newsletters
use_cases.description: Compile and format major announcements, achievements, and updates into a digestible company newsletter
use_cases.target_user: Executive assistants, internal communications teams, leadership

use_cases.title: Employee FAQ Compilation
use_cases.description: Identify common employee questions and provide clear, authoritative answers to reduce confusion
use_cases.target_user: HR teams, internal communications, leadership during major changes

use_cases.title: General Internal Announcements
use_cases.description: Draft professional internal communications that don't fit standard formats
use_cases.target_user: Any employee needing to communicate broadly within the company

prompt_templates.title: Create a 3P Update
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a 3P update for the [team name] covering [date range]. Here's what we accomplished: [progress items]. We're planning to: [plan items]. Current blockers: [problem items].
prompt_templates.scenario: End of week status reporting for leadership

prompt_templates.title: Company Newsletter
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a company newsletter for the week of [date range]. Major highlights include: [list key events, launches, announcements, milestones].

prompt_templates.title: FAQ Document
prompt_templates.prompt: Based on recent employee questions about [topic], create an FAQ document. Common questions I'm seeing: [list questions].
prompt_templates.scenario: Addressing widespread confusion after major announcement

prompt_templates.title: Custom Internal Comm
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me write an internal communication about [topic] for [audience]. The tone should be [formal/casual/urgent]. Key points to cover: [list points].

best_practices: Always confirm team name and time period before drafting 3P updates
Use data and metrics whenever possible to make updates concrete
Keep tone matter-of-fact and avoid excessive prose
Ensure newsletters are scannable with clear sections and bullet points
Link to source materials (docs, Slack threads, emails) for credibility
Match the company's existing communication style and voice
Focus on company-wide impact for newsletters, not team-specific minutiae
Base FAQ answers on official company communications when available
anti_patterns: Writing 3Ps that are too long (should be 30-60 seconds to read)
Including overly granular technical details in executive-facing updates
Creating newsletters without clear sectioning or hierarchy
Answering FAQs with speculation instead of confirmed information
Using inconsistent formatting that doesn't match the provided templates
Forgetting to include the emoji and proper header format for 3Ps
Writing in passive voice or burying the key information

faq.question: What does 3P stand for?
faq.answer: 3P stands for Progress, Plans, and Problems - a concise format for weekly team updates that covers what was accomplished, what's planned next, and current blockers.

faq.question: How long should a 3P update be?
faq.answer: 3P updates should be readable in 30-60 seconds, with each section (Progress, Plans, Problems) being 1-3 sentences maximum.

faq.question: Can this skill access my company's Slack or email?
faq.answer: Only if you have MCP integrations configured. Otherwise, the skill will ask you to provide the information directly and focus on formatting it properly.

faq.question: What's the difference between a 3P and a company newsletter?
faq.answer: 3Ps are team-specific, weekly updates for executives. Newsletters are company-wide communications covering multiple teams and initiatives, typically 20-25 bullets organized by theme.

faq.question: Can I customize the format?
faq.answer: The skill follows established corporate formats strictly to maintain consistency, but you can use the general-comms template for custom formatting needs.
